title: Understanding the CJMM
text: The Clinical Judgment Measurement Model (CJMM) is a framework used in nursing to guide clinical decision-making. It consists of several key components that help nurses assess and respond to patient needs effectively.

title: Components of CJMM
text: Think about the steps involved in making a clinical decision. What are the logical steps a nurse might take from recognizing a problem to evaluating the outcome?

hintAnswer: (1) recognize cues, (2) analyze cues, (3) prioritize hypotheses, (4) generate solutions, (5) take actions, and (6) evaluate outcomes.
title: Identifying the Steps
text: List the steps involved in the Clinical Judgment Measurement Model (CJMM).
choices: (1) recognize cues, (2) analyze cues, (3) prioritize hypotheses, (4) generate solutions, (5) take actions, and (6) evaluate outcomes.
(1) recognize cues, (2) analyze cues, (3) prioritize hypotheses, (4) generate solutions, (5) take actions
